snippet: The slam dunk has captivated the basketball world for a generation with its raw ferocity and balletic grace, but this year a different shot is sweeping the N.B.A. playoffs: the teardrop.
abstract: Slam dunk has captivated basketball world for generation with its raw ferocity and balletic grace, but teardrop shot is sweeping 2013 NBA playoffs; if slam dunk is all power, teardrop is all finesse, usually tossed up by smallest player on floor, and handful of point guards in this year's playoffs are using it to take control of a game.

byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nate Taylor and Zach Schonbrun from New York, and Lorne Chan and Dan McCarney from San Antonio.

lead_paragraph: The slam dunk has captivated the basketball world for a generation with its raw ferocity and balletic grace, but this year a different shot is sweeping the N.B.A. playoffs: the teardrop.

headline.seo: With Teardrop Shots, N.B.A.’s Little Guys Gain Upper Hand
headline.main: With Hop and Flick, Little Guys Get Upper Hand
headline.print_headline: With Hop and Flick, Little Guys Get Upper Hand
